member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasGradientMeshPatch
member.summary: Describes a patch which can comprise a gradient mesh.

remarks.p: A bezier patch is defined by four bezier curves along its edges, four interior control points, and colors at each of the four corners. Given its grid of sixteen control points, a patch has a bezier curve for each of its four rows, and for each of its four columns. These cubic bezier curves determine the area filled by the patch, and its gradient color.
The colors in the interior are a bilinearly interpolated between the corner colors.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Graphics.Canvas.Geometry.CanvasGradientMesh
member.summary: A drawable set of bezier patches, consisting of interpolated colors.

remarks.p: A gradient mesh is comprised of some number of patches. A patch is an area defined by four bezier curves, and colors to describe the corners. See for more information.
Although it isn't terribly useful, a gradient mesh can have zero patches.
When using Direct2D interop, this Win2D class corresponds to the Direct2D interface ID2D1GradientMesh.
